channel.title: CyberNetSec - Incident Response
channel.description: Latest incident response threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: UK Regulators Issue Cyber Recovery Guide for Financial Firms
item.description:
The United Kingdom's top financial regulators—the Bank of England (BoE), the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), and the Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA)—have jointly published a guide on effective cyber response and recovery practices. The guidance, aimed at all financial firms, emphasizes the ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

item.title: EU Launches Cybersecurity Reserve to Bolster Incident Response Across Member States
item.description:
The European Union has officially established the European Cybersecurity Reserve as a key component of its Cyber Solidarity Act. Managed by the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA), the reserve has a €36 million budget and consists of 45 pre-vetted, trusted private providers, such as Airbus Protect a...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

item.title: AWS Outage in us-east-1 Knocks Major Global Services Offline
item.description:
A significant infrastructure fault within Amazon Web Services' (AWS) us-east-1 region in North Virginia on October 20, 2025, triggered a global outage affecting numerous major online services. Platforms including Snapchat, Fortnite, Disney Plus, and various banking applications experienced widesprea...

Severity: High

Categories: Cloud Security, Incident Response

item.title: North Korean IT Worker Fraud Scheme Expands, Targeting 5,000 Companies
item.description:
A sophisticated North Korean scheme using fraudulent IT worker personas to infiltrate companies has expanded into a massive global operation. According to a report from October 11, 2025, researchers have identified over 130 fake identities used in more than 6,500 job interviews with approximately 5,...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Incident Response, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Jaguar Land Rover Begins Phased Restart a Month After Crippling Cyberattack
item.description:
On October 7, 2025, Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) announced it is beginning a phased restart of its manufacturing plants, more than a month after a major cyberattack on August 31 halted its global operations. The attack disrupted everything from production lines and parts flow to retail systems. The resta...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Incident Response, Industrial Control Systems
